section.name: Recurring build problems
section.p: These represent "known problems". In some cases, they represent a temporary problem that will be synched up at the point of the next release, in other cases they may represent an abject failure to communicate.

subsection.name: jakarta-cactus
subsection.p: Generally the Tomcat tests for 22, and *sometimes* 23, fail on Solaris. Current status can be found here.

subsection.name: jakarta-turbine
subsection.p: The various turbine implementations are coded directly to the xml-xerces1 API and will not survive intact to Xerces 2. A patch enabling pluggable parser support for one such component (torque) was prepared in November, but has never been applied.

subsection.name: xml-xerces2
subsection.p: The tests for xml-security and xml-xalan2, both of which pass cleanly with xerces1, fail with xerces2.
A complete gump run using xerces2 can be found here.

section.name: Other Issues
section.p: These represent versioning issues that will not show up in any Gump run, but you may need to be aware.

subsection.name: jakarta-turbine
subsection.p: Based on inspection, I don't believe that turbine-2 and turbine-3 can coexist in a classpath. The jakarta-jetspeed, jakarta-turbine-jyve, and jakarta-turbine-orgami projects depend on turbine-2. The jakarta-turbine-flux project depends on turbine-3.

subsection.name: jakarta-velocity
subsection.p: The combination of Texen, Ant 1.4 or later, and placing jars on your classpath can result in unexpected behavior. This has been isolated to a standalone test case and being investigated by the Ant development team. Meanwhile, an undocumented attribute, reverseloader, which when set to the value "true" on taskdefs which defines texen may help.

section.name: Recent success stories
section.p: This section describes cross project compatibility issues which were:

ul.li: the changes would likely have otherwise gone undetected until release
involved changes to one or both products
the changes were done prior to release.

subsection.name: dbxml
subsection.p: October 2001: The Xalan team is in the process of changing an undocumented API that dbXML used. The dbXML team determined that the reason that they were using that undocumented API no longer applies. This was corrected after the second beta of dbXML - meaning that the users of their next release will be able to upgrade smoothly to Xalan 2.2 once it is released.

subsection.name: jakarta-log4j
subsection.p: September 2001: in order to more closely resemble the JSR 47 API, the Level class replaced the Priority class, and the Logger class replaced the Category class. This was originally done in a manner which was thought to be backwards compatible, but there was subtle reasons why this was not the case.

subsection.name: jakarta-ant
subsection.p: December 2001: a manifest task was added to Ant which collided with the manifest task contained within xml-fop. What followed was the most impressive cooperation between projects I have ever witnessed. The fop project removed their manifest task, and the Ant project changed their code so that the manifest task that fop previous had would have overridden the one provided with Ant.
